title: Example
text: vignette going see example usage package first, let’s start loading package Let’s suppose want see data numbers game megasena portuguese, therefore can , want see winners lotofacil portuguese can use data create plots  analyse data:
code: # install.packages("lotterybr") library(lotterybr) library(ggplot2) megasena_numbers = get_data(game = "megasena", type = "numbers", language = "ptbr") head(megasena_numbers) ## # A tibble: 6 × 4 ##   data       concurso acumula dezenas ##   <date>        <int> <chr>   <fct>   ## 1 1996-03-11        1 sim     04      ## 2 1996-03-11        1 sim     05      ## 3 1996-03-11        1 sim     30      ## 4 1996-03-11        1 sim     33      ## 5 1996-03-11        1 sim     41      ## 6 1996-03-11        1 sim     52 lotofacil_winners = get_data(game = "lotofacil", type = "winners", language = "eng") head(lotofacil_winners) ## # A tibble: 6 × 6 ##   date       course accumulated match winners   prize ##   <date>      <int> <chr>       <chr>   <int>   <dbl> ## 1 2003-09-29      1 no          15          5  49766. ## 2 2003-09-29      1 no          14        154    690. ## 3 2003-09-29      1 no          13       4645     10  ## 4 2003-09-29      1 no          12      48807      4  ## 5 2003-09-29      1 no          11     257593      2  ## 6 2003-10-06      2 no          15          1 596324. ggplot(lotofacil_winners, aes(x = factor(match), y = winners, fill = match)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +   labs(x = "Match", y = "Winners frequency", title = "Winners by Match") +   theme_minimal() df = data.frame(   dezenas =summary(     megasena_numbers$dezenas     )   ) summary(df$dezenas) ##    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.  ##   239.0   276.8   289.0   289.7   305.0   344.0 head(df) ##    dezenas ## 01     272 ## 02     287 ## 03     269 ## 04     305 ## 05     315 ## 06     293

title: Lottery Brasil
text: function can use following way

title: Lottery Brasil
text: game two datasets, numbers winners, following columns:

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Date type, date game occurred .

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Integer type, course game took place

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Char type, game prize accumulated “yes” “”

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Factor type 60 levels, drawn numbers.

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Date type, date game occurred .

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Integer type, course game took place .

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Char type, game prize accumulated “yes” “”

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Char type, possible match.

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Integer type, number winners possible match.

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Integer type, prize type. games, like “duplasena” “diadesorte”, may contain additional columns since game different way drawing numbers. Therefore, brief explanation game follows.

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Maismilionaria involves selecting five numbers one pool one additional number another pool, potential win multimillion-dollar jackpots.

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Six numbers drawn pool 60, players aiming match many possible substantial prizes.

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Lotofacil involves picking 15 numbers pool 25, prizes awarded varying levels matches.

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Players select five numbers pool 80, aiming match many possible prizes.

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Lotomania involves selecting 50 numbers pool 100, prizes awarded matching certain number drawn numbers.

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Dupla-Sena involves two separate draws, six numbers drawn pool 50, offering double chances win.

title: Lottery Brasil
text: Dia de Sorte, players choose seven numbers month, prizes awarded matching numbers /month drawn.

title: Lottery Brasil
text: function can use following way opens shiny app containing graph, table brief description selected game data type. langugage argument, can select either Portuguese English. can view app clicking

what: Lottery Datasets from Caixa Economica Federal
title: Lottery Datasets from Caixa Economica Federal
text: goal package provide function automatically import data lotteries Caixa Econômica Federal R environment. Data lotteries Caixa Econômica Federal includes information various games Mega-Sena, Lotofácil, Quina, among others. downloaded official website Federal Savings Bank https://loterias.caixa.gov.br/.

title: Lottery Datasets from Caixa Economica Federal
text: can install development version lotterybr like :

title: Lottery Datasets from Caixa Economica Federal
text: Downloading Lotofacil winners data: Opening shiny app
code: library(lotterybr)  lotofacil <- get_data(game= "lotofacil", type= "winners") library(lotterybr) open_app()

what: Function to download lottery data from git repository — get_data
title: Function to download lottery data from git repository — get_data
text: function downloads Brazilian lottery game data Caixa Federal date declared

title: Function to download lottery data from git repository — get_data
code: get_data(   game = c("maismilionaria", "megasena", "lotofacil", "quina", "lotomania", "duplasena",     "diadesorte"),   type = c("numbers", "winners"),   language = "eng" )

title: Function to download lottery data from git repository — get_data
text: game select Brazilian lottery game type select want winners database numbers result language select desired language

title: Function to download lottery data from git repository — get_data
text: tibble/data.frame containing downloaded data

title: Function to download lottery data from git repository — get_data
code: # \donttest{ library(lotterybr) megasena_ganhadores <- get_data(game= "megasena",type = "winners",language = "eng") megasena_ganhadores #> # A tibble: 8,697 × 6 #>    date       course accumulated match winners    prize #>    <date>      <int> <chr>       <chr>   <int>    <dbl> #>  1 1996-03-11      1 yes         6           0       0  #>  2 1996-03-11      1 yes         5          17   39159. #>  3 1996-03-11      1 yes         4        2016     330. #>  4 1996-03-18      2 no          6           1 2307162. #>  5 1996-03-18      2 no          5          65   14424. #>  6 1996-03-18      2 no          4        4488     209. #>  7 1996-03-25      3 no          6           2  391193. #>  8 1996-03-25      3 no          5          62   10516. #>  9 1996-03-25      3 no          4        4261     153. #> 10 1996-04-01      4 yes         6           0       0  #> # ℹ 8,687 more rows  lotofacil_dezenas <- get_data(game= "lotofacil",type = "numbers", language = "ptbr") lotofacil_dezenas #> # A tibble: 46,665 × 4 #>    data       concurso acumula dezenas #>    <date>        <int> <chr>   <chr>   #>  1 2003-09-29        1 nao     02      #>  2 2003-09-29        1 nao     03      #>  3 2003-09-29        1 nao     05      #>  4 2003-09-29        1 nao     06      #>  5 2003-09-29        1 nao     09      #>  6 2003-09-29        1 nao     10      #>  7 2003-09-29        1 nao     11      #>  8 2003-09-29        1 nao     13      #>  9 2003-09-29        1 nao     14      #> 10 2003-09-29        1 nao     16      #> # ℹ 46,655 more rows # }

what: Open Shiny app for data visualization — open_app
title: Open Shiny app for data visualization — open_app
text: function opens shiny app uses datasets provided

title: Open Shiny app for data visualization — open_app
Open Shiny app for data visualization — open_app
text: language select language app . Options "pt" Portuguese "en" English.

title: Open Shiny app for data visualization — open_app
text: None. function launches Shiny application.

title: Open Shiny app for data visualization — open_app
text: function opens Shiny application corresponding specified language Brazilian lottery data.

title: lotterybr 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-05-07 Initial CRAN submission.

title: lotterybr 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-06-07 Added Shiny App two language options, portuguese english, default english Added Language option get_data, portuguese english, default english
